required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation Between the Polymorphism ofβ2 AR and the Labor Progress After Labor Analgesia

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanjing Maternity and Child Health Care Hospital

clinical_study.source: Nanjing Maternity and Child Health Care Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Labor and delivery is a unique physiological experience of women. Inappropriate length of labor progress during vaginal delivery may produce great risks for mother and fetus. Especially the slow progress is one of the most important reasons for the occurrence of cesarean section during vaginal delivery, which still with a high incidence in recent years.Previous studies have found that there was a significant correlation between the genetic polymorphisms of β 2-adrenergic receptor (β2AR) and the duration of vaginal delivery.Therefore, the researchers intend to investigate the distribution of β2-adrenergic receptor (β2AR) genetic polymorphisms among Chinese parturient and observe the relationship between the genetic polymorphisms and labor process after labor analgesia.

primary_outcome.description: time from the regular uterus contractions until completed childbirth, assessed up to about 24h
time from the regular uterus contractions to full cervix dilation,assessed up to about 20h
time from full cervix dilation to the complete childbirth, assessed up to about 2h

primary_outcome.time_frame: At time of initiation of analgesia and hourly thereafter until 2 hours postpartum (approximately 10 hours)
primary_outcome.description: At time of initiation of analgesia and hourly thereafter until 2 hours postpartum (approximately 10 hours)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of initiation of analgesia and hourly thereafter until 2 hours postpartum (approximately 10 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: At time of initiation of analgesia and hourly thereafter until 2 hours postpartum (approximately 10 hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rescue boluses, n of rescue boluses, and the consumption of the ropivacaine/sufentanil mixture

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the first and fifth minutes after baby was born
secondary_outcome.description: At the first and fifth minutes after baby was born

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal heart rate, respiratory rate, and blood pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of initiation of analgesia and hourly thereafter until 4 hours postpartum (approximately 12 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: At time of initiation of analgesia and hourly thereafter until 4 hours postpartum (approximately 12 hours)

study_pop.textblock: The parturient undergoing labor analgesia in our hospital. And the eligible parturient aged at 23-43, gestational age 35-42 weeks with an ASA grade I-II, who spontaneously choosing vaginal delivery mode with epidural analgesia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Nulliparous women
- Required labor analgesia
- Chinese
- Spontaneous labor
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications for epidural analgesia
- Allergic to opioids and/or local anesthetics
- Failed to performing epidural catheterization
- Organic dysfunction
- Those who were not willing to or could not finish the whole study at any time
- Using or used in the past 14 days of the monoamine oxidase inhibitors
- Alcohol addictive or narcotic dependent patients
- Subjects with a nonvertex presentation or scheduled induction of labor
- Twin gestation and breech presentation

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Nanjing Maternity and Child Health Care Hospital
responsible_party.investigator_title: Nanjing Maternity and Child Health Care Hospital
